gene.function: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the O-methylation, and thereby the inactivation, of catecholamine neurotransmitters and catechol hormones. Also shortens the biological half-lives of certain neuroactive drugs, like L-DOPA, alpha-methyl DOPA and isoproterenol. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11559542, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21846718}.
gene.subcellularLocation: SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: [Isoform Soluble]: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11559542}.; SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: [Isoform Membrane-bound]: Cell membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21846718}; Single-pass type II membrane protein {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21846718}; Extracellular side {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21846718}.
geneOntologyBiologicalProcess: negative regulation of dopamine metabolic process [GO:0045963]
negative regulation of renal sodium excretion [GO:0035814]
negative regulation of smooth muscle cell proliferation [GO:0048662]
positive regulation of homocysteine metabolic process [GO:0050668]
regulation of sensory perception of pain [GO:0051930]
